The Logic Sensor reads inventory contents from chests, barrels, vaults, depots, and more
logiclink.ponder.tag.sensor_kinetics.des: The Logic Sensor reads RPM, stress, and overstressed status from kinetic blocks
logiclink.ponder.tag.sensor_fluids.descr: The Logic Sensor reads fluid type, amount, and capacity from tanks and basins
logiclink.ponder.tag.sensor_heat.descrip: The Logic Sensor reads heat level from Blaze Burners
logiclink.ponder.tag.link_logistics.desc: The Logic Link bridges Create's logistics network with CC:Tweaked computers
logiclink.ponder.tag.link_sensors.descri: Logic Sensors provide wireless machine data to any Logic Link on the same network
logiclink.ponder.tag.link_computers.desc: Place a CC:Tweaked computer adjacent to access the peripheral via Lua
logiclink.ponder.tag.rc_redstone_links.d: The Redstone Controller transmits and receives on Create's Redstone Link frequencies
logiclink.ponder.tag.rc_lamps.descriptio: Control redstone-powered blocks like lamps and pistons wirelessly
logiclink.ponder.logic_link_overview.tex: Create's logistics network connects storage and packagers
Right-click a Stock Link to copy its frequency, then place the Logic Link
Place a CC:Tweaked computer adjacent — it detects the Logic Link as a peripheral
14 Lua functions: list items, request deliveries, read sensors, monitor gauges
Access the entire network's inventory from a single computer
logiclink.ponder.logic_sensor_overview.t: Attach to a chest to read its inventory
Works with barrels, vaults, and any container
Mount on Create machines to read kinetic speed and stress
Reads inventory and fluid data from basins and tanks
Link sensors to a network for wireless access through any Logic Link
7 Lua functions — getData(), getTargetData(), refresh(), and more
logiclink.ponder.redstone_controller_ove: The Redstone Controller interfaces with Create's Redstone Link network
Control it from a CC:Tweaked computer via Lua scripts
Each frequency pair matches a physical Create Redstone Link
One block controls unlimited channels — replacing many physical Redstone Links
setOutput() transmits, getInput() receives — all controlled from Lua
8 Lua functions: setOutput, getInput, getChannels, setAllOutputs, and more
logiclink.ponder.tag.motor_kinetics.desc: Logic Motors and Drives generate or modify rotational force controlled by CC:Tweaked computers
logiclink.ponder.tag.motor_computers.des: Set speed, direction, and sequences from Lua programs
logiclink.ponder.tag.motor_sequences.des: Program timed rotation sequences with rotate, wait, and speed steps
logiclink.ponder.creative_logic_motor_ov: Creative Logic Motor — Programmable Rotation Source
The Creative Logic Motor is a CC-controlled rotation source with unlimited stress capacity
Place a CC:Tweaked computer adjacent to control the motor via Lua
setSpeed(rpm) controls rotation from -256 to 256 RPM — no external power needed
Powers any Create machine — press, mixer, saw, fan, and more
Program sequences: rotate a set number of degrees, wait, then change speed
16 Lua functions: setSpeed, stop, rotate, addSequenceStep, runSequence, and more
logiclink.ponder.logic_drive_overview.te: The Logic Drive modifies rotation passing through it — controlled by a CC:Tweaked computer
The ORANGE-marked side is the DRIVE INPUT — connect your power source (shaft, water wheel, etc.) here
The LIGHT BLUE side is the CC OUTPUT — modified rotation exits here to your machines
Attach a CC:Tweaked computer to control the drive via Lua peripheral functions
setModifier(2.0) doubles output speed, setModifier(-1.0) reverses it — like a programmable gearshift
17 Lua functions: enable, disable, setReversed, setModifier, addRotateStep, runSequence, and more
